comments:
I am trying to make an srm connection by right clicking on connection tab and selecting "New Global Connection".

I am entering the following values:
Scheme: srm
SRM Host: plethon.grid.ucy.ac.cy
SRM Port: 8443
Remote Dir: /

Are these values wrong? When I click on "create a temporary connection" I get the following exception:

Nick, could you please check with port 8444? 8443 is usually SRM version 1, and 8444 is v2.1 unless the siteadmin changed the defaults.

This seems to be the case (that you try to connect to v1) since the error message says
Method 'ns1:srmLs' not implemented

I would then convert this bug into an enhancement request, what about calling getVersion() when creating a new connection? if the call doesn't succeed then pop up a dialog to the user "the port you entered doesn't run an SRM v2.X service"
Mateusz, what do you think?
Ariel, it works fine with port 8444. So this should turn into an enchancment request or it should be marked as fixed :)
Closing this one, enhancement request tracked in #210601
Closing it now, verified already by reporter
